statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 2 \\ 4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 9 \\ -6 \\ -12 \\ -9 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -18 \\ 12 \\ 24 \\ 18 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 2 \\ 4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 9 \\ -6 \\ -12 \\ -9 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -18 \\ 12 \\ 24 \\ 18 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
